etymologies: Sanskrit, ‘a person whose essence is perfect knowledge’, from bodhi ‘perfect knowledge’ (from budh- ‘know perfectly’) + sattva ‘being, essence’

definitions: (in Mahayana Buddhism) a person who is able to reach nirvana but delays doing so out of compassion in order to save suffering beings.
shortDefinitions: (in Mahayana Buddhism) person who is able to reach nirvana but delays doing so through compassion for suffering beings
